items.sentence: It\'ll take me a long time to do all the things I want to do.
You can lie to everyone else, but you can\'t lie to yourself.
It\'s wrong to deceive people, but worse to deceive yourself.
Let\'s go to the theater early so that we can get good seats.
I wouldn\'t have recognized Tom if he hadn\'t been with Mary.
I\'m not sure if I\'m going to be able to come to your party.
Tom doesn\'t know how to say what he wants to say in English.
Tom hadn\'t eaten anything the whole day and was very hungry.
Tom wanted to play poker with us, but Mary wouldn\'t let him.
Why haven\'t you told Tom when and where the meeting will be?
Tom rented a suite in one of Boston\'s most expensive hotels.
I don\'t like the smell of the perfume Mary is wearing today.
I think that we\'re just beginning to understand the problem.
I was surprised when Tom told me you didn\'t have to do that.
Maybe it\'s time to throw in the towel and do something else.
Tom\'s parents told him that playing with fire was dangerous.
What business is it of yours what I want to do with my money?
Would you look after my children while I am away on vacation?
You might want to encourage Tom to do his own homework early.
Do you think it\'s a good idea to feed your dog table scraps?
